item.title: Barrack Communism - wikipedia
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism Article link: Barracks communism - Wikipedia Barracks communism[1] (German: Kasernenkommunismus)[2] is the term coined by Karl Marx[3] to refer to a crude, authoritarian, forced collectivism and communism where all aspects of life are bureaucratically regimented and communal.

item.title: Marxism - Absolute equality is an unhelpful political goal
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism #youtube Article link: Why equality is unhelpful as a political goal - YouTube Introduction A common argument against Marxism that I’ve heard from the right, is that, Marxism cannot work because it strives after absolute equality, and this is bound to fail because humans are unequal by nature.

item.title: marxism - conflict is the driving force of history
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism related notes: [[Marxism The class struggle under Capitalism]] [[Marxism - Working Class vs Proletariat]] When Karl Marx said that conflict is the driving force of history, he meant that the way societies change is through the conflict between different social classes.

item.title: Marxism - Dialectical Materialism
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism Article link: Dialectical materialism | Definition & Facts | Britannica Definition Materialism in Marxism is the belief that the material world, or the world of physical objects and processes, is the primary reality.

item.title: Marxism - Dialectics
item.description: #internetContent #keyConcepts #philosophy/marxism Article link: Dialectic - Wikipedia related notes: [[Marxism - Dialectical Materialism]] Dialectics in Marxism is a method of understanding the world that emphasizes the role of conflict and change.

item.title: Marxism - Marx And Engels Were Not Egalitarians
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism #article Article link: Marx and Engels Were Not Egalitarians – Zoe Baker related notes: [[Marxism - Absolute equality is an unhelpful political goal]] Marx and Engels are often depicted as egalitarians by people on the right.

item.title: Marxism - Neomarxism
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism Article link: Neo-Marxism - Wikipedia Neo-Marxism is a broad term that refers to a variety of schools of thought that have developed out of Marxism since the early 20th century.

item.title: Marxism - Rules of Marxist Dialectics
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism #keyConcepts Article link: related notes: [[Marxism - Dialectics]], [[Marxism - Dialectical Materialism]], Three main rules There are no hard and fast rules in Marxist dialectics, or dialectical materialism.

item.title: Marxism - Working Class vs Proletariat
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism Article link: working class/giai cấp công nhân vs protelariat/ giai cấp vô sản Giai cấp công nhân là một thuật ngữ chung để chỉ những người làm việc trong các ngành công nghiệp, sản xuất hàng hóa và dịch vụ.

item.title: Marxism The class struggle under Capitalism
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/marxism #economy Article link: Class struggle - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Cause for them to sell.

item.title: The Problem With Human Rights - CCK Philosophy
item.description: #internetContent #philosophy/ethic #youtube #philosophy/marxism Article link: The Problem With Human Rights - YouTube Human rights today have the kind of status that the divine right of kings had in the Middle Ages.
